Module WitchHunt
Package fr.sos.witchhunt.controller

Interface InputMediator

All Known Implementing Classes:
ConcreteInputMediator
public interface InputMediator

Interface implemented by the central input controller

Makes the link between the Model's components and the View's components..

Specifies the methods required by the Model's components which require user inputs.

See Also:
  • InputMediator
  • ConcreteInputMediator

  • Method Details

    • answerYesNoQuestion

      boolean answerYesNoQuestion() throws InterruptedException
      Answers a yes-no question based on user-input.
      Returns:
      true if the user has chosen "yes", false if they have chosen "no".
      Throws:
      InterruptedException

    • wannaContinue

      void wannaContinue()
      Asks for user-input from the view before continuing further.

    • createPlayer

      Player createPlayer(int id, List<String> chosenNames, boolean optionnal)

      Requests the View to gather information from user-input in order to create a player to add to the game.

      Parameters:
      id - The id of the player that is to be created.
      chosenNames - The list of all already taken player names.
      optionnal - true if the minimum number of players has already been reached.
      Returns:
      The player, created on the basis of the information gathered from user-input
      See Also:
      • Player

    • createPlayer

      Player createPlayer(int id, String name, boolean isHuman)

      Lets the input mediator create a player with the given parameters and become this new player's input mediator.

      Parameters:
      id - The id of the player that is to be created.
      name - The new player's name
      isHuman - true if the player is human-controlled
      Returns:
      The player, created on the basis of the information gathered from user-input
      See Also:
      • Player

    • makeChoice

      int makeChoice(Menu possibilities)

      Requests the View to get an input from the user corresponding to a choice of the given Menu

      Only calls for input and display error messages concerning that input

      The display of the menu itselfs is achieved by a class implementing DisplayMediator

      Parameters:
      possibilities - An instance of Menu, with a given title and given options
      Returns:
      A positive int corresponding to the position of the selected option in the given Menu's array of choices.

    • receive

      void receive()

      Sends an empty signal to the input mediator.

      See Also:
      • InputSource

    • receive

      void receive(int i)

      Sends an integer to the input mediator.

      See Also:
      • InputSource

    • receive

      void receive(String str)

      Sends a string to the input mediator.

      See Also:
      • InputSource

    • receive

      void receive(Player p)

      Sends a player to the input mediator.

      Parameters:
      p - The sent player

    • getStringInput

      String getStringInput() throws InterruptedException
      Requests the input mediator to collect a string from the user
      Returns:
      The received string.
      Throws:
      InterruptedException

    • interruptStdInput

      void interruptStdInput()
      Requests the input mediator to interrupt input gathering from the console.
